chapter.title: Upgrade from &productname; &prevproductnumber; to &productnumber;
chapter.para: This chapter introduces steps to upgrade &productname; &prevproductnumber; to version &productnumber;.
The upgrade includes the following tasks:

sect1.title: Before upgrading

sect2.title: Points to consider
sect2.para: Before upgrading, ensure you read through the following sections to ensure you understand all tasks that need to be executed.

listitem.para: Read the release notes. In them, you can find additional information on changes since the previous release of &productname;. Check the release notes to see whether:
Any used software packages have changed significantly.
Special precautions are necessary for your installation.
The release notes also provide information that could not make it into the manual on time. They also contain notes about known issues.
You can find SES &productnumber; release notes online at .

Additionally, after having installed the package release-notes-ses from the SES &productnumber; repository, you can find the release notes locally in the directory /usr/share/doc/release-notes or online at .
Read to familiarise yourself with &cephsalt; and the &ceph; orchestrator, and in particular the information on service specifications.

sect2.title: Backing Up cluster configuration and data
sect2.para: We strongly recommend backing up all cluster configuration and data before starting the upgrade. For instructions on how to back up all your data, see .

sect1.title: Migrate &sls; on each cluster node to version &cephos;
sect1.para: If the cluster nodes are configured to use &scc;, you can use the zypper migration command.
If the cluster nodes have software repositories configured manually, you need to upgrade the nodes manually.
For detailed information about upgrading &sls; using zypper, refer to .

important.para: &productname; &productnumber; does not use the rgw_frontend_ssl_key option. Instead, both the SSL key and certificate are concatenated under the rgw_frontend_ssl_certificate option. If the &ogw; deployment uses the rgw_frontend_ssl_key option, it will not be available after the upgrade to &productname; &productnumber;. In this case, the &ogw; must be redeployed with the rgw_frontend_ssl_certificate option. Refer to for more details.
